p: Caffeic acid could also inhibit the cytotoxicity of Stx in a Vero-d2EGFP cell-based assay, in a process independent from the alteration of the induction of 933J and 933W [ 114]. Gallic and caffeic acids at low concentration (around 10 –6 mg/mL) and tannins (0.5 mg/mL) reduced the infectivity of PL-1 (infecting L. casei) by 80–90% [ 81]. Others reported that both tannic (0.01–0.1 mg/mL) and gallic (0.1–0.4 mg/mL) acids had negligible action upon the infectivity of MS2, with a reduction that reached a maximum of 0.06 log 10 [ 82].
